pr_title: [core] Add an initialize method to the Category and Plugin

timeline.message:
[core] Add an initialize method to the Category and Plugin

Publish the results of each category's initialization to the Hub.

Related: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-android/issues/209
Related: https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-android/issues/215

timeline.bodyText: Can this just be in CategoryTypeable directly instead of specifying it for each override?
timeline.author: raphkim
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -25,9 +30,15 @@
  * @param <E> The type of class returned by the plugin implementation to be used as an escape hatch
  */
 public abstract class AnalyticsPlugin<E> implements AnalyticsCategoryBehavior, Plugin<E> {
+    @NonNull

replies.bodyText: Also applies to a lot of inherited methods from Category.java and Plugin.java
replies.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: (See comment below about Android Studio code inspections.)
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText: Same thing as categorytype (i.e. specify @NonNull annotation inside interface rather than on each inherited method)
timeline.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: I don't know the convention around this actually. But Android Studio will suggest to put it on every @Override method as well as the base one. Adding this here makes a code inspection warning go away.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText: oh yea, we had to change all the plugins to be abstract classes, but not sure why DataStorePlugin was still interface. Good catch
timeline.author: raphkim

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this be implemented in the actual plugin implementation? I see that you already have the implementation in AWSDataStorePlugin.java, so can we remove it from the abstract class?
timeline.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: Oh now I see you have it on every category. I'm assuming that this is to make implementation of this "optional"?
replies.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: Exactly, yea - I wanted to cut down on boiler plate for the actual final plugin implementation. Plugins like our AndroidLoggingPlugin don't have any work to do in intitialize(), so they don't have to override this method.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText: Is this advice still true now that we support terminate()?
timeline.author: raphkim
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -109,45 +103,46 @@ public void configure(
         } catch (DataStoreException badConfigException) {
             throw new DataStoreException(
                 "There was an issue configuring the plugin from the amplifyconfiguration.json",
-                    badConfigException,
-                    "Check the attached exception for more details and " +
+                badConfigException,
+                "Check the attached exception for more details and " +
                     "be sure you are only calling Amplify.configure once"

replies.bodyText: I didn't add terminate() as part of this PR, yet, actually :-( That's still needed.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText:
Pedantic, but can we do either

isSuccess() & isFailure(), or
isSuccessful() & isFailed()

for consistent grammar lol
timeline.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: Yes!! Good catch. Thanks. I'll update.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.author: raphkim

timeline.bodyText: same comment as the one in CategoryInitializationResult
timeline.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: Updating to the noun pair, success/failure.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText:
A plugin is an implementation of a category's behavior

Well technically Plugin by itself is just an interface... It promises that it's configurable & that it always belongs to a certain category. But to be honest, I'm not sure how better this structure can be documented so I think this is fine
timeline.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: Eh, yea - just now I tried to make it more technically accurate, I ended up with things like "An implementation of a plugin is an implementation of ..." which is confusing in-and-of-itself.
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.author: raphkim

replies.bodyText: Ah yes, this should say @Nullable, will update
replies.author: jamesonwilliams

timeline.bodyText: nice. I only found out that hub plugins are supposed to be available pre-configuration in that meeting, so I didn't account for that.
timeline.author: raphkim
